benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{childAccountId}/transferCredit - Move a given child credit to the parent level

covered: PUT method: Valid Request scenarios (TC01, TC02)
gaps: PUT method: Non-Existing Resource coverage (TC04, TC07, TC12) partially covered but no explicit test for updating a previously-existing resource after deletion or similar edge-case sequences
PUT method: Concurrency Issues (TC14) covered but explicit race-condition stress testing and data integrity under concurrent updates could be richer
PUT method: Authorization/Authentication coverage (TC10) present but could include explicit 401/403 per role-based access patterns
PUT method: Validation and input format coverage (TC07, TC11, TC15) present but could expand to more malformed payload tests (e.g., invalid JSON body, invalid numeric ranges)
PUT method: Error handling for server/database failures (TC09 with 503) present but no explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario
PUT method: Large datasets / performance testing (TC13) covered, but broader pagination/scan tests not relevant for PUT, though performance edge-cases could be expanded
Caching and HTTP semantics (ETag, Cache-Control) not tested
Audit/logging validation beyond headers (TC02) could be extended to verify full audit entries for all error cases
Backward compatibility (TC17) present but no explicit checks for multiple API version headers or migration paths
Edge-case of extra unsupported headers (TC08) covered but no test ensuring strict header validation across all required headers
recommendations: Add explicit 401/403 coverage per role-based access to satisfy Authorization guideline with concrete scenarios
Add a dedicated 500 Internal Server Error scenario to cover database/server-side failure modes
Introduce explicit negative tests for invalid/empty JSON payloads and malformed request bodies
Enhance concurrency testing with stronger race-condition scenarios and data integrity verification under heavy load
Add caching-related tests (ETag/Cache-Control) where applicable for PUT endpoints
Incorporate rate-limiting tests to verify behavior under high request throughput
Extend auditing verification to confirm complete and precise audit logs for all success and failure cases
Consider an explicit API versioning compatibility check in TC17-like scenarios with multiple client versions
Clarify and narrow some ambiguous expectations in test steps to ensure deterministic outcomes (e.g., exact error messages)
